channel.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
channel.description: Hi, If I had 4 micro SD cards, each with a different patch saved on it, would I then be able to switch between the SD cards in a live setting, without needing my laptop? I want to use my Electro Harmonix 45000 loop pedal to capture a few minutes of sound, then to overlay a new sound.... It's not cheap, but having multiple Micro SD cards would be preferable to carrying my laptop to every gig. Thanks!

item.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
item.dc:creator: @Yot
item.description:
@Yot wrote:

I would say less than 1 second.

Read full topic
item.source: Question: Using patches in a live setting

item.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
item.dc:creator: @mlbstrd
item.description:
@mlbstrd wrote:

What's the changeover time with loading new patches? Is it pretty snappy, or does it take some seconds?

Read full topic

item.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

check in the browser, there are three kinds of patch/load. if beatstep sends program change message, you have part of the work done, if not, you will have to find your way..

Read full topic
item.source: Question: Using patches in a live setting

item.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
item.dc:creator: @ampism
item.description:
@ampism wrote:

Thanks servandisco. Am still reading different posts about this. Do you mean that any midi controller could potentially do this? I am using an Arturia Keystep - the sequencer function works so well with the axoloti! No idea how to use that to change patches though....

Read full topic
item.source: Question: Using patches in a live setting

item.title: Question: Using patches in a live setting
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

with one sd card it's enough, you can switch patches using a midi controller or from the buttons integrated in the axoloti. certainly, swapping sdcards with different startup patches it's gonna save you some patching time configuring the patch load object but if you have some time, maybe its worth trying

Read full topic
item.source: Question: Using patches in a live setting
